title: University Hospital Center Dr Dragiša Mišović
text:
University Hospital Center Dr Dragiša Mišović () or Clinical Hospital Center Dr Dragiša Mišović Dedinje, is a health facility of <a href="Health%20care%23Secondary%20care">secondary level</a> in <a href="Belgrade">Belgrade</a>, that performs specialist health care in its hospitals and clinics.
It is based on modern principles of <a href="health%20care">health care</a>. It serves as a teaching facility of the <a href="University%20of%20Belgrade%20School%20of%20Medicine">University of Belgrade School of Medicine</a>. It was established in 1930, and it is named after Dragiša Mišović, a pre–<a href="World%20War%20II">WWII</a> <a href="Communism">communist</a> and <a href="Physician">doctor</a>.
History.
History of Dr Dragiša Mišović Complex begins with 1920s. Former Society of Young Women Doctors gained a place near Dedinje from <a href="%C4%90or%C4%91e%20Vajfert">Georg Weifert</a>. In 1930, by architectural design of Živan Nikolić, was built an object designed for Belgrade mistress' rest (today's Children Hospital for Pulmonary Diseases and <a href="Tuberculosis">Tuberculosis</a>).
On 24 October 2009, a great fire accident occurred in central building of the Hospital Center, which interrupted a lot future operating of the center. Regardless, the main services are still active in emerged circumstances.
